page.title: 03MARSHBOROUGH FARM
page.content: Marshborough Farm grows wheat and red Desiree Potatoes. Mr Kemp showed us corn silos and we were allowed inside to have a look. They are all black and very hot. They are used for drying and storing the corn which can be pumped into them and out again. Hot air can be circulated by a fan. We went into the very long thatched barn. It was empty so we had a race from one end to the other. It can hold 400 tons of potatoes. We looked at the reservoir. It can hold four million gallons of water which is used to water the crops. We went into the old oast house and saw three furnaces on the ground floor. There were some old stilts once used for stringing and harvesting the hops. We saw the wheel they used for measuring land. It measures a rod which 16.5 ft. (about 5 metres).
